2117.example: The terrace runs the full width of the house.

2118.definition: the quality of being happy and ready to do something
2118.example: Success in studying depends on a willingness to learn.

2119.definition: to rub something against a surface, in order to remove dirt or liquid from it; to rub a surface with a cloth, etc. in order to clean it
2119.example: wipe something (on something), Please wipe your feet on the mat.

2120.definition: the ability to make sensible decisions and give good advice because of the experience and knowledge that you have
2120.example: She was known to be a woman of great wisdom.

2121.definition: the ability to say or write things that are both clever and humorous

2122.definition: to take money out of a bank account
2122.example: withdraw something, With this account, you can withdraw up to £300 a day.

2123.definition: the act of taking an amount of money out of your bank account
2123.example: You can make withdrawals of up to $250 a day.

2124.definition: all the people who work for a particular company, organization, etc.

2125.definition: a period of physical exercise that you do to keep fit
2125.example: She does a 20-minute workout every morning.

2126.definition: the office, factory, etc. where people work
2126.example: the introduction of new technology into the workplace

2127.definition: a period of discussion and practical work on a particular subject, in which a group of people share their knowledge and experience
2127.example: There will be the opportunity for practical theatre work in drama workshops.

2128.definition: a long, thin creature with a soft body and no bones or legs

2129.definition: the practice of showing respect for God or a god, by saying prayers, singing with others, etc.; a ceremony for this

2130.definition: to show respect for God or a god, especially by saying prayers, singing, etc. with other people in a religious building
2130.example: The Mayans built jungle pyramids to worship their gods.

2131.definition: important, pleasant, interesting, etc.; worth spending time, money or effort on
2131.example: It was in aid of a worthwhile cause (= a charity, etc.).

2132.definition: having the qualities that deserve somebody/something
2132.example: Very few of his ideas are worthy of further attention.

2133.definition: the joint between the hand and the arm

2134.definition: to shout loudly, for example because you are angry, excited, frightened or in pain
2134.example: yell (at somebody/something), He yelled at the other driver.

2135.definition: the total amount of crops, profits, etc. that are produced

2136.definition: the total amount of crops, profits, etc. that are produced

2137.definition: a young person or a child
2137.example: The camp is for youngsters aged 8 to 14.
